appendix.title: Glossary
appendix.para: A person with limited access to cloud resources in &ostack;. An application operator provides services to end users or hosts services for his own development activities.

A key/value pair that allows for a flexible and concise description of the data to be monitored, for example, region, availability zone, service tier, or resource ID. Each dimension describes a specific characteristic of the metrics to be monitored.
In &productmonitoring;, metrics are uniquely identified by a name and a set of dimensions. Dimensions can serve as a filter for the monitoring data.

An open source application that provides a highly scalable full-text search and analytics engine. &productmonitoring; uses &elasticsearch; as the underlying technology for storing, searching, and analyzing large volumes of log data.
An open source application for visualizing large-scale measurement data. &productmonitoring; integrates with Grafana for visualizing the monitoring data.
The delivery of computer infrastructure (typically a platform virtualization environment) as a service.

An open source time-series database that supports high write loads and large data set storage. &productmonitoring; uses InfluxDB as the underlying technology for storing metrics and the alarm history.
An open source analytics and visualization platform designed to work with &elasticsearch;. &productmonitoring; integrates with Kibana for visualizing the log data.

An open source relational database that provides an SQL-compliant interface for accessing data. &productmonitoring; uses MariaDB as the underlying technology for storing configuration information, alarm definitions, and notification methods.

Self-describing data structures that allow for a flexible and concise description of the data to be monitored. Metrics values represent the actual monitoring data that is collected and presented in &productmonitoring;.
An open source Monitoring as a Service solution that integrates with &ostack;. It forms the core of &productmonitoring;.
A person responsible for maintaining and administrating &productmonitoring;.
A person responsible for maintaining and administrating &ostack;, the underlying platform technology of &productmonitoring;.
The delivery of a computing platform and solution stack as a service.
A model of software deployment where a provider licenses an application to customers for use as a service on demand.
